phrases: Water.
Earth.
Fire.
Air.
Long ago, the four nations lived together in harmony.
Then, everything changed when the Fire Nation attacked.
Only the Avatar, master of all four elements, could stop them.
But when the world needed him most, he vanished.
A hundred years passed, and my brother and I discovered the new Avatar...
And although his airbending skills are great.
He has a lot to learn before he is ready to save anyone.
But I believe Aang can save the world.
Would you sit down?
If we hit a bump you will go flying off!
What is bugging you anyway?
It is what Avatar Roku said.
I am supposed to master all four elements before that comet arrives.
Well, let us see,...
I have not even started waterbending and we are still weeks away from the North Pole!
What am I going to do!?
Calm down.
It is going to be okay.
If you want, I can try and teach you some of the stuff I know.
You would do that?
We will need to find a good source of water first.
Maybe we can find a puddle for you to splash in.
Nice puddle.
Yehhh!
Do not start without me, boy!
Remember the reason we are here.
Oh right, time to practice waterbending.
Great.
So what am I supposed to do?
You could... clean the gunk out of Appa's toes?
So, while you guys are playing in the water,...
Mud and bugs!
Okay.
Someone is changing our course!
What is the meaning of this mutiny?
No one told you to change course!
Actually, someone did.
I assure you it is a matter of utmost importance, Prince Zuko.
Is it something to do with the Avatar?
Even more urgent.
It seems...
I have lost my lotus tile.
Lotus tile?
For my Pai Sho game.
Most people think the lotus tile insignificant,...
You have changed our course for a stupid lotus tile?
See, you, like most people, underestimate its value.
Just give me ten minutes to check the merchants at this port of call.
Hopefully they will have the lotus tile in stock and I can get on with my life!
I am lucky to have such an understanding nephew.
Yeh, do not get too happy.
You got to do me next.
This is a pretty basic move, but it still took me months to perfect,...
Just push and pull the water like this...
The key is getting the wrist movement right.
Like this?
That is almost right, if you keep practicing, I am sure eventually...
Hey, I am bending it already!
Wow, I cannot believe you got that so quickly.
It took me two months to learn that move.
Well, you had to figure it out on your own.
I am lucky enough to have a great teacher.
Thanks.
So, what is next?
This is a more difficult move.
I call it streaming the water.
It is harder than it looks so do not be disappointed if...
Nice work, though the over-the-head flare was unnecessary.
Sorry.
Well, do not stop now, keep'them coming!
Well, I kind of know this one other move, but it is pretty hard.
I have not even totally figured it out yet.
The idea is to create a big, powerful wave...
So, like this?
Aang!
Looks like I got the hang of that move!
What else ya got?
That is enough practicing for today.
Yeh, I will say!
You just practiced our supplies down the river!
Uhhh... sorry.
I am sure we can find somewhere to replace all this stuff.
Ugh, it was hard enough when you were just an airbender.
We have got exactly three copper pieces left from the money that King Bumi gave us.
Let us spend it wisely.
Uhh, make that two copper pieces, Sokka.
I could not say no to this whistle!
It does not even work.
See, even Momo thinks it is a piece of junk.
No offense, Aang, but I will hold the money from now on.
Earth Nation!
Fire Nation!
Water Nation!
Do not be shy, come one by!
Oh!
You there!
I can see by your clothing that you are world traveling types.
Perhaps I can interest you in some exotic curios?
Sure!
What are curios?
I am not entirely sure, but we got'them!
I have never seen such a fine specimen of lemur.
That beast would fetch me a hefty sum if you would be, interested in bartering.
Momo's not for sale.
Look at this, Aang!
It is a waterbending scroll.
Check out these crazy moves!
Where did you get a waterbending scroll?
Let us just say I got it up north at a most reasonable price.
Free!
Waaait a minute sea-loving traders with suspiciously acquired merchandise...
We prefer to think of ourselves as high risk traders.
So, how much for the, uh, traded scroll?
I have already got a buyer, a nobleman in the Earth Kingdom.
Unless, of course, you kids have 200 gold pieces on ya right now?
I know how to deal with these guys, Katara, pirates love to haggle.
Watch and learn.
What say to the price of... one copper piece!
The price is 200 gold pieces.
I do not haggle on items this rare.
Okay... two copper pieces!
It is not as amusing the second time, boy.
Aang, can we get out of here, I feel like we are getting weird looks.
Aye, we be castin' off now!
What was that all about, Katara.
Yeh, I was just starting to browse through their boomerang collection.
I will just feel a lot better once we get away from here.
Hey you, get back here!
Well, well, look who is come to their senses.
Told ya the haggling would pay off.
There they are!
Get'them!
Nobody's going nowhere!
Get back here!
This way!
Let us cut'them off!
My cabbages!
This place is worse than Omashu!
I hope that lemur of yours has nine lives!
Now, who gets to take the steel of my blade first?
No thanks!
Hold on tight!
Aang, I thought we were running away from the pirates!
Just hang on!
I used to kind of look up to pirates, but those guys are terrible.
I know, that is why I took... this!
No way.
Is not it great?
No wonder they were trying to hack us up.
You stole their waterbending scroll.
I prefer to think of it as high-risk trading.
Good one, Katara.
Sokka, where do you think they got it?
They stole it from a waterbender.
It does not matter.
You put all of our lives in danger just so you could learn some stupid, fancy splashes!
These are real waterbending forms.
You know how crucial it is for Aang to learn waterbending.
Whatever.
Well, what is done is done.
We have it.
We might as well learn from it.
I have checked all the shops on this pier.
Not a lotus tile in the entire marketplace.
It is good to know this trip was a complete waste of time for everyone!
Quite the contrary.
I always say the only thing better than finding something you were looking for,...
You bought a sumki horn?
For music night on the ship.
Now, if we only had some woodwinds.
This place looks promising!
Ooo!
That is handsome!
Would not it look magnificent in the galley?
We lost the Water Tribe girl and the little bald monk she was traveling with.
This monk, did he have an arrow on his head?
I just want to try this one move first and then it is all yours.
Here, hold on and open for me.
The single water whip... looks doable.
What is so funny?
I am sorry, but you deserve that.
You have been duped.
She is only interested in teaching herself.
Aang will get his turn once I figure out the water whip!
Why cannot I get this stupid move!
You will get it.
You just got to shift your weight through the stances...
There.
See, the key to bending is...
Will you please shut your air hole!
Believe it or not, your infinite wisdom gets a little old sometimes.
Why do not we just throw the scroll away since you are so naturally gifted!
What?
Omigosh, Aang, I am so sorry.
I do not know what came over me.
But, you know what, it will not happen again.
Here, this is yours.
I do not want to have anything to do with it anymore.
It is okay, Katara.
What about Momo?
He is the real victim here.
I am sorry Momo.
And... what about me?
There was that time you...
No more apologies!
Should not we stop to search the woods?
We do not need to stop.
They stole a waterbending scroll, right?
Then they will be on the water.
Shh!
Momo, go back to sleep.
Shoot!
Come on water, work with me here!
Okay, Katara, shift your weight through the stances... ugh!
No, let go of me!
I will save you from the pirates.
Tell me where he is and I will not hurt you or your brother.
Go jump in the river!
Try to understand, I need to capture to restore something I have lost.
My honor.
Perhaps in exchange I can restore something you have lost.
My mother's necklace!
How did you get that?
I did not steal it, if that is what you are wondering.
Tell me where he is.
No!
Enough of this necklace garbage.
You promised the scroll!
I wonder how much money this is worth?
A lot, apparently.
Now you help me find what I want, you will get this back and everyone goes home happy.
Search the woods for the boy and meet back here.
Fine.
Huh?
Where did she go?
I do not believe it.
What is wrong?
She took the scroll!
She is obsessed with that thing.
It is just a matter of time before she gets us all in deep...
I got him, come on!
Oh, what?
I am not good enough to kidnap?
Nice work.
Aang, this is all my fault.
No, Katara it is not.
Yeh, it kind of is.
Give me the boy.
You give us the scroll.
You are really going to hand over the Avatar for a stupid piece of parchment!?
Do not listen to him!
He is trying to turn us against each other.
Your friend is the Avatar?
Sure is, and I will bet he will fetch a lot more on the black market then that fancy scroll.
Shut your mouth, you water tribe peasant!
Yeh, Sokka, you really should shut your mouth...
I am just sayin', it is bad business sense.
Just imagine how much the Fire Lord would pay for the Avatar.
You guys would be set for life!
Keep the scroll!
We can buy a hundred with the reward we will get for the kid.
You will regret breaking a deal with me!
Thanks, Momo.
I owe you a bushel of apples.
Aang, are you there?
I am over here, follow my voice!
Where?
I cannot find you!
I am right here!
Uhh, never mind!
I will find you!
Run!
Katara!
You are okay!
Help me get this boat back in the water so we can get out of here!
We need a team of rhinos to budge this ship.
A team of rhinos... or two waterbenders?
Everybody in!
Are you so busy fighting you cannot see your own ship has set sail?
We have no time for your proverbs, Uncle!
It is no proverb.
Bleeding hog-monkeys!
Hey!
That is my boat!
Maybe it should be a proverb.
Come on, Uncle!
Sokka!
Cannot you make it go any faster?
I do not know how.
This thing was not made by the water tribe.
Hey, you did the water whip!
I could not have done it without your help!
Will you two quit congratulating each other and help me out!
That is good!
Aang, look!
Oh, no!
Have you lost your mind!?
This is no time for flute practice!
We can stop the boat!
Aang, together, push and pull the water!
It is working!
It is slowing down!
We are doing it!
But we have another problem!
I knew a bison whistle would come in handy.
Thanks, Appa.
Yeh, we owe ya one.
My boat!
Hehe, Prince Zuko, you are really going to get a kick out of this.
The lotus tile was in my sleeve the whole time!
Aang, I still owe you an apology.
You were just so good at waterbending without really trying.
I got so competitive that I put us all in danger.
I am sorry.
That is okay, Katara.
Besides, who needs that stupid scroll anyway.
Is that really how you feel?
The scroll!
First, what did you learn?
Stealing is wrong.
Unless it is from pirates!
Good one, Katara.
